channel.title: Compiler does not start?
channel.description: So I played rsps for a long time, and decided to make my server.... I followed a guide and it was awesome. I portfowarded got java and such. I followed a video to change the sources name and I changed it easily. Then the video told me to compile.. I was like :| ok? I clicked the compiler and it flashes _ and a space every second. After 12 or so seconds it told me [tt]Press any key to continue . . . [/tt] So the compiler didn't even start [i]( This also happens in some of my old clients I use to play, it told me that and it never started )[/i]and I've googled it up and no one has this problem. I've done research and this [b]never[/b] happened to anyone or so I think. I used the search button, so don't tell me that.. Please help with the compiler issue and I won't rep but I'll be thankful .

item.title: Compiler does not start?
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

[quote=“dawwn, post:1, topic:443868”]So I played rsps for a long time, and decided to make my server… I followed a guide and it was awesome. I portfowarded got java and such. I followed a video to change the sources name and I changed it easily. Then the video told me to compile… I was like ok? I clicked the compiler and it flashes _ and a space every second. After 12 or so seconds it told me
[tt]Press any key to continue . . . [/tt]
So the compiler didn’t even start ( This also happens in some of my old clients I use to play, it told me that and it never started )and I’ve googled it up and no one has this problem. I’ve done research and this never happened to anyone or so I think. I used the search button, so don’t tell me that… Please help with the compiler issue and I won’t rep but I’ll be thankful .[/quote]
It’s that what the compiler’s suppose to do LOl.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler does not start?
item.dc:creator: @T0xicsnip3r T0xicsnip3r
item.description:
@T0xicsnip3r wrote:

@echo off
title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_04\bin\javac.exe” -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event*.java src\server\model\items*.java src\server\model\minigames*.java src\server\model\npcs*.java src\server\model\objects*.java src\server\model\players*.java src\server\model\players\skills*.java src\server\model\players\packets*.java src\server\model\shops*.java src\server\net*.java src\server\task*.java src\server\util*.java src\server\world*.java src\server\util\log*.java src\server*.java src\server\world\map*.java
pause

if ur using windows 7 check to see if ur jdk version is in program files (x86) if so go into compiler and edit it, and make it say this "C:Program Files (x86)\Java…etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler does not start?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

try this compiler code

[code]@echo off
:menu
title Compiler

echo Errors:
echo
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\InternetExplorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Compiling Finished.
pause
exit [/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler does not start?
item.dc:creator: @dawwn dawwn
item.description:
@dawwn wrote:

Camballer:

It has to do with your classpath. The classpath in the compiler doesn’t match the classpath of your computer. Watch this video if you need help---- http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mhyqo-Z4sxg&feature=related

I did that asweel wat is the compiler suppos to show anyway?

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler does not start?
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

It has to do with your classpath. The classpath in the compiler doesn’t match the classpath of your computer. Watch this video if you need help---- http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mhyqo-Z4sxg&feature=related

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler does not start?
item.dc:creator: @dawwn dawwn
item.description:
@dawwn wrote:

[quote=“nickog15, post:2, topic:443868”]Open notepad
Copy and paste this

[quote]@echo off
Title Client Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause[/quote]
Replace bold with your jdk
Save as complier.bat
run.[/quote]

I did that already… same thing

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler does not start?
item.dc:creator: @nickog15 nickog15
item.description:
@nickog15 wrote:

Open notepad
Copy and paste this

@echo off Title Client Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk[b]1.6.0_18[/b]\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause
Replace bold with your jdk Save as complier.bat run.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler does not start?

item.description:

So I played rsps for a long time, and decided to make my server… I followed a guide and it was awesome. I portfowarded got java and such. I followed a video to change the sources name and I changed it easily. Then the video told me to compile… I was like ok? I clicked the compiler and it flashes _ and a space every second. So the compiler didn’t even start ( This also happens in some of my old clients I use to play, it told me that and it never started )and I’ve googled it up and no one has this problem. I’ve done research and this never happened to anyone or so I think. I used the search button, so don’t tell me that… Please help with the compiler issue and I won’t rep but I’ll be thankful .
